content.raw:
I apologize in advance for not having screencasts of this, but we are encountering a strange behavior of the robots. If one ends up backed up to a wall in a curved tunnel \(with no clutter\), it seems to lose all friction with the ground and can’t go forward again. In our controller, we have some corrective behavior, where it will try to back up and then go forward again if it gets stuck, but in this position it will just switch between those states forever and stay stuck. We have reproduced this several times, including Friday  with the most recent code \(catkin install\). We have not tried to reproduce it with teleop. 

We have also occasionally seen collision problems with the cluttered tiles - namely, wheels going through rocks. We’ve had some agents get stuck on rocks, and we’re not sure now if they actually get stuck, or if it’s a consequence of the collision problem. See picture.

‌
content.html:
I apologize in advance for not having screencasts of this, but we are encountering a strange behavior of the robots. If one ends up backed up to a wall in a curved tunnel (with no clutter), it seems to lose all friction with the ground and can’t go forward again. In our controller, we have some corrective behavior, where it will try to back up and then go forward again if it gets stuck, but in this position it will just switch between those states forever and stay stuck. We have reproduced this several times, including Friday with the most recent code (catkin install). We have not tried to reproduce it with teleop.

We have also occasionally seen collision problems with the cluttered tiles - namely, wheels going through rocks. We’ve had some agents get stuck on rocks, and we’re not sure now if they actually get stuck, or if it’s a consequence of the collision problem. See picture.

‌
